page.title: 15Laverstock community concern
page.content: Each year, the Laverstock Village Fete Committee, representing most of the Clubs and societies - and the Church - at Laverstock, organise its annual Fete during the month of June. This has happened each year since 1977. This year they helped raise funds for the Blood Cell Seperator to help in the fight against leukaemia. Over the years over Â£3000 has been raised for hospital associated projects. Money though very impotant, is not the committee's main concern.{It exists to {give the village a Family Day Out. There was this year, the traditional Fancy Dress procession from the village green and led by the Shrewton Silver Band and Empress Majorettes to the Social Club Field Site off Church Road.Many families supported the event enjoying several displays from local groups as well a comic football match.
